pull.title: Banlist updates
pull.body: Recovering #6371 which was basically ready to merge when @Diapolo decided to leave

events.message:
banlist: update set dirty to be more fine grained

- move the SetBannedSetDirty(false) call from DumpData() into DumpBanlist()
- ensure we only set false, if the write succeeded

banlist: better handling of banlist in StartNode()

- only start working on/with banlist data, if reading in the banlist from
  disk didn't fail
- as CNode::setBannedIsDirty is false (default) when reading fails, we
  don't need to explicitly set it to false to prevent writing
  banlist.dat in that case either

banlist: add more banlist infos to log / add GUI signal

- to match the peers.dat handling also supply a debug.log entry for how
  many entries were loaded from banlist.dat and how long it took
- add a GUI init message for loading the banlist (same as with peers.dat)

- move the same message for peers.dat upwards in the code, to be able to
  reuse the timing variable nStart and also just log, if our read from
  peers.dat didn't fail

banlist (bugfix): allow CNode::SweepBanned() to run on interval

- allows CNode::SweepBanned() to run, even if !CNode::BannedSetIsDirty(),
  because if nBanUntil is over we want the ban to be disabled for these
  nodes

events.body: This looks like consistency cleanup/refactor. Any new feature to test here?

issue.title: [Port] various banned list fixes
issue.body:
This is bitcoin#7350.

    e8600c9 banlist (bugfix): allow CNode::SweepBanned() to run on interval (Philip Kaufmann)
    2977c24 banlist: add more banlist infos to log / add GUI signal (Philip Kaufmann)
    ce479aa banlist: better handling of banlist in StartNode() (Philip Kaufmann)
    57c77fe banlist: update set dirty to be more fine grained (Philip Kaufmann)

issue.title: Backport Bitcoin PR#7350: Banlist updates
issue.body:
This is backport of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#7350, that is merge of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#6371.

I'm backporting this PR because it makes changes in places that are touched by further big networking refactoring.

Original description of Bitcoin PR#7350 fllows.
---
Recovering bitcoin/bitcoin#6371 which was basically ready to merge when @Diapolo decided to leave

Original description of Bitcoin PR#6371 follows.
---
banlist: update set dirty to be more fine grained

* move the SetBannedSetDirty(false) call from DumpData() into DumpBanlist()
* ensure we only set false, if the write succeeded

banlist: better handling of banlist in StartNode()

* only start working on/with banlist data, if reading in the banlist from disk didn't fail
* as CNode::setBannedIsDirty is false (default) when reading fails, we don't need to explicitly set it to false to prevent writing banlist.dat in that case either

banlist: add more banlist infos to log / add GUI signal

* to match the peers.dat handling also supply a debug.log entry for how many entries were loaded from banlist.dat and how long it took
* add a GUI init message for loading the banlist (same as with peers.dat)
* move the same message for peers.dat upwards in the code, to be able to reuse the timing variable nStart and also just log, if our read from peers.dat didn't fail

banlist (bugfix): allow CNode::SweepBanned() to run on interval

* allows CNode::SweepBanned() to run, even if !CNode::BannedSetIsDirty(), because if nBanUntil is over we want the ban to be disabled for these nodes

issue.title: banlist.dat: store banlist on disk
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6310
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6315
  - Only the new signal and net changes, no QT.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7350
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7458
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7696
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7959
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7906
  - Only the ban-related commits.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8392
  - Only the second commit.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8085
  - Only the second commit.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10564
- bitcoin/bitcoin#13061
  - Wasn't needed when I first made this backport in 2017, but it is now!

Part of #2074.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

issue.title: [Net] Banlist updates
issue.body: Minor updates to how the banlist is handled. ported from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7350
